news_header: Electricity outage in Cuba affected the country due to a fault in the largest power plant.
news_text: An electricity outage began in Cuba on Friday, primarily affecting Havana, where power has since been restored to nearly 90% of the city. The outage was caused by a fault in the country's largest power plant. Cuban President Miguel Diaz-Canel emphasized the government's stance against sexual assault. The situation recalls the widespread protests in July 2021 when many took to the streets due to power outages.
